title: Run Dick, run Jane
creator_credit: Scott Whitaker and Brigham Young University
brief_description: Based on Kenneth Cooper’s book, “The New Aerobics”, shows how regular exercise can be valuable insurance against heart disease. Illustrates through laboratory statistics and case studies the benfits of a personal fitness program. Includes views of Peter Strudwick, who jogs with no feet, and Larry Lewis, 103 year-old San Francisco waiter who ran six miles every morning before work.
